name: unaspirated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a spoken sound) not involving the use of the breath: In Indian English, all voiceless stops are unaspirated. In Cantonese, the stops and affricates have aspirated and unaspirated pairs.
More examplesFewer examplesIn this dialect, there are six pairs of aspirated and unaspirated consonants, and all of them are voiceless.German dialects have unaspirated [p⁼ t⁼ k⁼] as well as aspirated [pʰ tʰ kʰ].The women who were raised in French-speaking families use unaspirated stops about one-third of the time.
